Package moulton.scalable.texts

Interface TextInputComponent

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HotkeyTextComponent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StaticTextBox, TextBox
    public interface TextInputComponent
    Implementations of HotkeyTextComponent are instances of Clickable that receive text input from the MenuManager through the appendMessage(String) and removeMessage(int). methods.
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void appendMessage​(java.lang.String string)
      When this component is selected and the menu manager receives key input from the user, it is sent to the component through this method.
      void removeMessage​(int chars)
      When this component is selected and the menu manager receives delete key input from the user, this component is notified through this method.

    • Method Detail

      • appendMessage

        void appendMessage​(java.lang.String string)
        When this component is selected and the menu manager receives key input from the user, it is sent to the component through this method.
        Parameters:
        string - the text to append

      • removeMessage

        void removeMessage​(int chars)
        When this component is selected and the menu manager receives delete key input from the user, this component is notified through this method.
        Parameters:
        chars - the number of characters requested to delete. If chars is positive, characters will be deleted from right to left (backspace). If chars is positive, characters will be deleted from left to right (delete).
